that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind Striving together for the saith of the gospelff 'b If you are harassed by some temporal vexation‚ it ought the more to remind you how you ought to think of that life which you are to live without any toil, escaping not the vexatious hardships of this fleeting age, but the terrible penalties of the everlast- ing fire. And if the death which ends the toil of this life inspires such sear, how gleatly that death is to be feared which casts men into everlasting pain! And if the vile and short lived charnis of this world are so loved, how much more eagerly are the undefiled and unending joys of the world to come to be sought after! Meditate upon these things and be not slothful in good works‚ that in due season you may come to the harvest of your sowing.
